alert.note: Alert for Alexander; Catawba; Greater Caldwell; Iredell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 9:11PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Catawba, Alexander, western Iredell and southeastern Caldwell Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 910 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Lenoir to 4 miles south of Hickory to 9 miles northwest of Lincolnton. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hickory, Newton, Taylorsville, St. Stephens, Conover, Longview, Bethlehem, Maiden, Stony Point and Claremont. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Conditions are favorable for development of a very brief, weak tornado. Be prepared to take immediate action if a tornado is sighted or a Tornado Warning is issued.
